Quote: A developed country is not a place where the poor have cars; it's where the rich use public transport.
Author: Enrique Penalosa

Quote: The truth is, I don’t know that people really love driving in LA any more.
Author: Seleta Reynolds
Author_Title: General Manager of the City of Los Angeles Department of Transportation

Quote: Organisation vor Elektronik vor Beton (Organization before Electronics before Concrete)
All models are wrong, but some are useful
Author: George Edward Pelham Box

Quote: Widening roads to solve traffic congestion is like loosening your belt to cure obesity.
Author: Roy Kienitz
Author_Title: Executive Director of the Surface Transportation Policy Project

Quote: Increasing highway capacity is equivalent to giving bigger shoes to growing children
Author: Robert Dunphy

Quote: Traffic engineers often compare traffic to a fluid, assuming that a certain volume must flow through the road system. But urban traffic may be more comparable to a gas that expands to fill available space.
Author: Jacobsen

Quote: Avoid, shift, improve (Vermeiden, verlagern und verträglicher machen)
No one should be killed or seriously injured within the road traffic system
Author: 1997 Sweedish Legislature

Quote: The first of the ten commandments of Urban Planning: 'You shall never construct a pedestrian bridge.'
Author: Rodrigo Diaz

Quote: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quote: It is by riding a bicycle that you learn the contours of a country best, since you have to sweat up the hills and can coast down them.... Thus you remember them as they actually are, while in a motorcar only a high hill impresses you, and you have no such accurate remembrance of country you have driven through as you gain by riding a bicycle.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quote: Let me tell you what I think of bicycling. I think it has done more to emancipate women than anything else in the world. I stand and rejoice every time I see a woman ride by on a wheel. It gives a woman a feeling of freedom and self-reliance. It makes her feel as if she were independent. The moment she takes her seat she knows she can't get into harm unless she gets off her bicycle, and away she goes, the picture of free, untrammelled womanhood.
Author: Susan B. Anthony

Quote: Nothing compares to the simple pleasure of a bike ride.
Author: John F. Kennedy

Quote: Everything is going to be fine in the end. If it's not fine it's not the end.
Author: Oscar Wilde
